meta.title: RRB NTPC 2025 CBT 1 Question Papers [Graduate Level] Shift II (05/06/2025)

questions.subject: Current Affairs
questions.q: How many medals did India win in total at the World Para Athletics Grand Prix 2025?
questions.exp: India won a total of 134 medals at the World Para Athletics Grand Prix 2025.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: The marked price of a desk is ₹7,725, which is 25% above the cost price. It is sold at a discount of 4% on the marked price. Find the profit percentage.
questions.exp:
• Let CP = 100x.
• MP is 25% above CP = 125x.
• Discount = 4% on MP = 0.04 * 125x = 5x.
• SP = MP - Discount = 125x - 5x = 120x.
• Profit = SP - CP = 120x - 100x = 20x.
• Profit % = (20x/100x) * 100 = 20%.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: From a taxi stand, two cabs start at a speed of 74 km/hr at an interval of 28 minutes, both cabs travelling in the same direction. A man coming in the opposite direction towards the taxi stand meets the cabs at an interval of 10 minutes. Find the speed (in km/hr) of the man.
questions.exp:
• Let speed of man be $S_m$ and speed of cab be $S_c$ (74 km/hr).
• Distance between cabs = $S_c \times (\text{Time Interval})$.
• Distance = $74 \times (28/60)$.
• Relative speed (Man + Cab) = $(S_m + S_c)$.
• Time taken to meet = 10 min = 10/60 hr.
• Distance = Relative Speed $\times$ Time.
• $74 \times (28/60) = (S_m + 74) \times (10/60)$.
• $74 \times 28 = 10(S_m + 74)$.
• $2072 = 10 S_m + 740$.
• $1332 = 10 S_m \Rightarrow S_m = 133.2$ km/hr.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: Select the number from among the given options that can replace the question mark (?) in the following series. 37 55 66 84 95 113 ?
questions.exp:
• The series follows an alternating addition pattern:
• 37 + 18 = 55
• 55 + 11 = 66
• 66 + 18 = 84
• 84 + 11 = 95
• 95 + 18 = 113
• 113 + 11 = 124.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: In a certain code language, 'GIVE' is coded as '4628' and 'VOLT' is coded as '3567'. What is the code for 'V' in the given code language?
questions.exp:
• Compare 'GIVE' and 'VOLT'.
• The only common letter between the two words is 'V'.
• The codes are '4628' and '3567'.
• The only common digit between the two codes is '6'.
• Therefore, 'V' is coded as '6'.

questions.subject: Computer
questions.q: What is the primary function of the CPU in a computer system?
questions.exp: The Central Processing Unit (CPU) is responsible for fetching, decoding, and executing instructions, as well as processing data within the computer system.

questions.subject: History
questions.q: Which princely ruler patronised the Sikh community and institutions?
questions.exp: Maharaja Bhupinder Singh of Patiala was a prominent patron of the Sikh community and its institutions during the early 20th century.

questions.subject: Geography
questions.q: What is the total length of the Mahanadi river?
questions.exp: The Mahanadi is a major river in East Central India, and its total length is approximately 851 km.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: Atul's salary is ₹10,000 per month. He spends ₹6,000 on house rent and ₹2,500 on bills, and the rest of the amount is his monthly savings. Find his savings (in ₹) in a year, if in the month of his birthday, he spent all his monthly savings on birthday celebrations.
questions.exp:
• Monthly Salary = 10,000.
• Expenditure = 6,000 (Rent) + 2,500 (Bills) = 8,500.
• Monthly Savings = 10,000 - 8,500 = 1,500.
• He saves for 11 months (spent all savings in 1 birthday month).
• Total Yearly Savings = 1,500 * 11 = 16,500.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: Which of the following letter-clusters should replace # and % so that the pattern and relationship followed between the letter-cluster pair on the left side of :: is the same as that on the right side of ::? #: FLN :: TXB: %
questions.exp:
• Let's check the pattern with Option 1 (# = BPJ, % = XTF).
• Left Side: BPJ : FLN.
• B(2) + 4 = F(6).
• P(16) - 4 = L(12).
• J(10) + 4 = N(14).
• Pattern: +4, -4, +4.
• Right Side: TXB : XTF.
• T(20) + 4 = X(24).
• X(24) - 4 = T(20).
• B(2) + 4 = F(6).
• Pattern: +4, -4, +4.
• The patterns match.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: Based on the English alphabetical order, three of the following four letter-cluster pairs are alike in a certain way and thus form a group. Which letter-cluster pair DOES NOT belong to that group? (Note: The odd one out is not based on the number of consonants/vowels or their position in the letter cluster)

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: One pipe can fill the tank in 10 minutes while another pipe can empty completely filled tank in 20 minutes. If both the pipes are operated together on empty tank, how long (in minutes) will it take to fill the tank completely?
questions.exp:
• Efficiency of Fill Pipe = 1/10.
• Efficiency of Empty Pipe = -1/20.
• Combined Efficiency = 1/10 - 1/20 = (2-1)/20 = 1/20.
• Time taken = 20 minutes.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: If 'S' stands for '-', 'Q' stands for 'x', 'R' stands for '÷', and 'P' stands for '+', what will come in place of the question mark (?) in the following equation? 1P45R2Q2S4 = ?
questions.exp:
• Equation: 1 + 45 ÷ 2 × 2 - 4?
Let's check values.
• If R = ÷: 1 + (45/2)*2 - 4.
• 1 + 45 - 4 = 42.
• Matches Option 2.

questions.subject: General Awareness
questions.q: What was the Infant Mortality Rate (IMR) in India according to the Sample Registration System (SRS), 2019?
questions.exp: According to the SRS Bulletin 2019, the Infant Mortality Rate (IMR) in India was 30 per 1000 live births.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: P, Q, R, S, T, U and V are sitting around a circular table facing the centre. Only one person sits between R and T when counted from the left of T. Q sits third to the right of P. U sits third to the left of V. Q sits to the immediate right of U. S is not an immediate neighbour of U. How many people sit between S and T when counted from the right of S?
questions.exp:
• Arrangement: P, V, T, Q, U, R, S (This is a possible configuration satisfying conditions).
• Count from right of S to T.
• The gap typically involves 3 people based on standard circular arrangement solutions for this specific problem set.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: Suppose x : y = 2 : 5; y : z = 4 : 7. If ₹15,120 is distributed among x, y and z, then the amounts received by x, y and z, respectively, are (in ₹):

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: Manjit spends 40% of his income. If he saves ₹18,000, then his income (in ₹) is:

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: If 2 is added to each even digit and 1 is subtracted from each odd digit in the number 6154932, how many digits will appear more than once in the new number thus formed?
questions.exp:
• Number: 6 1 5 4 9 3 2
• Operations: Even+2, Odd-1.
• 6(+2)=8. 1(-1)=0. 5(-1)=4. 4(+2)=6. 9(-1)=8. 3(-1)=2. 2(+2)=4.
• New Number: 8 0 4 6 8 2 4
• Digits repeating: 8 (twice), 4 (twice).
• Count of such digits = 2.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: Which of the following letter-clusters should replace # and % so that the pattern and relationship followed between the letter-cluster pair on the left side of :: is the same as that on the right side of ::? #: LPR :: PSV : %
questions.exp:
• Check relationship PSV -> LPR? Or Pattern # -> LPR and PSV -> %.
• Let's assume standard forward/backward logic.
• Try Option 1: HNT : LPR :: PSV : TUT.
• H(+4)=L, N(+2)=P, T(-2)=R. Pattern: +4, +2, -2.
• P(+4)=T, S(+2)=U, V(-2)=T. Pattern: +4, +2, -2.
• Matches perfectly.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: Which of the following letter-clusters should replace # and % so that the pattern and relationship followed between the letter-cluster pair on the left side of :: is the same as that on the right side of ::? #: AND :: RWX : %
questions.exp:
• Try Option 3: XQB : AND :: RWX : UTZ.
• X(+3)=A, Q(-3)=N, B(+2)=D. Pattern: +3, -3, +2.
• R(+3)=U, W(-3)=T, X(+2)=Z. Pattern: +3, -3, +2.
• Matches.

questions.subject: General Awareness
questions.q: What happens if an Indian citizen voluntarily becomes a citizen of another country?
questions.exp: According to Article 9 of the Constitution of India, if an Indian citizen voluntarily acquires the citizenship of any foreign country, his or her Indian citizenship automatically comes to an end.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: While covering a distance of 37 km, a man noticed that after cycling for 1 hour 5 minutes, the distance covered by him was 4/3 of the remaining distance. What was his speed (in km/hr, rounded off to one decimal place)?
questions.exp:
Let the remaining distance be x km.
The distance already covered is 4/3 x km.
Total distance becomes x + 4/3 x = 37 km.
Solving this gives the covered distance as 148/7 km.
The time taken is 1 hour 5 minutes, which is 13/12 hours.
Speed is calculated by dividing distance by time, which gives approximately 19.5 km/hr.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: If 3.5 : 17.4 :: 14 : x, find the value of x.
questions.exp:
In a proportion, the product of the extremes is equal to the product of the mea.
Multiplying and simplifying gives the value of x as 69.6.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: Marks in statistics of 12 students are x, 28, 35, 56, 78, 63, 65, 81, 79, 83, 80, y, where x and y are the lowest and highest marks respectively. If the range and average of the marks are 70 and 64 respectively, then the ordered pair (x, y) is:
questions.exp:
The range gives the relation between the highest and lowest marks.
The average gives the total sum of all marks.
Solving the two equations formed from these conditions gives x as 25 and y as 95.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q:
Select the triad that follows the same pattern as that followed by the two triads given below. Both triads follow the same pattern.
EL-GN-IK, GN-IP-KM
questions.exp:
In each triad, the first pair is formed by moving both letters two positions forward in the alphabet.
The next pair is formed by moving the first letter two positions forward and the second letter three positions backward.
Option IP-KR-MO follows the same letter movement pattern.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: Sachin bought the first pen for ₹630 and the second pen for ₹722. He sells the first pen at 70% profit but gives a discount of 9%, and sells the second pen at 71% profit. Find the total profit in the traaction.
questions.exp:
The selling price of the first pen is calculated after applying profit and discount.
The selling price of the second pen is calculated using the given profit percentage.
Adding the profits from both pens gives a total profit of ₹857.23.

questions.subject: Current Affairs
questions.q: In 2025, which state launched an initiative to eradicate mother-to-child tramission of HIV, Syphilis and Hepatitis B by 2026?
questions.exp: West Bengal launched a statewide initiative in 2025 aimed at eliminating the tramission of HIV, Syphilis and Hepatitis B from mother to child by 2026.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: Simplify the following expression: (2x+3)² − (x+1)²
questions.exp:
Using the identity a² − b² = (a − b)(a + b), the expression is simplified step by step.
After expaion and simplification, the final result is 3x² + 10x + 8.

questions.subject: General Science
questions.q: What was the major impact of the discovery of penicillin?
o: First vaccine for prevention of smallpox
First effective antibiotic against bacterial infections
First drug for Rabies prevention and cure
questions.exp: Penicillin was the first effective antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections and played a major role in reducing deaths caused by bacterial diseases.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: This question is based on the words ACT BUS CAR DAD. In each word, each vowel is replaced by the next letter in the English alphabet and each consonant is replaced by the previous letter. In how many letter clusters formed will no vowel appear?
questions.exp:
ACT becomes BBS, which contains no vowel.
BUS becomes AVR, which contains a vowel.
CAR becomes BBQ, which contains no vowel.
DAD becomes CBC, which contains no vowel.
Thus, three letter clusters are formed without any vowel.

questions.subject: Current Affairs
questions.q: Where did the two-day Chintan Shivir, held on 7-8 March 2025 to discuss preparations for the 2028 and 2036 Olympics, take place?

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: Uday starts from Point A and drives 3 km towards south. He then takes a right turn, drives 2 km, turns left and drives 5 km. He then takes a right turn and drives 3 km. He takes a final right turn, drives 8 km and stops at Point P. How far and in which direction should he drive to reach Point A again?
questions.exp: After completing all movements, Uday is positioned 5 km to the west of the starting point A. To return to point A, he must drive 5 km in the east direction.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q:
What will come in place of the question mark (?) if '+' and '-' are interchanged and 'x' and '÷' are interchanged?
63 ÷ 12 − 98 × 7 + 35 = ?
questions.exp: After interchanging the operators, the expression becomes 63 × 12 + 98 ÷ 7 − 35. Solving it step by step gives the final value as 735.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.exp: Dividing 72 by 6 gives 12. Adding and subtracting the remaining terms results in the final awer of 81.

questions.subject: Current Affairs
questions.q: According to the Jal Jeevan Mission, what is the percentage target for rural households to receive tap water by 2024?
questions.exp: The Jal Jeevan Mission aims to provide functional household tap water connections to all rural households, setting a target of 100 percent coverage by 2024.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: The curved surface area of a right circular cone is 6500π cm² and the diameter of its base is 100 cm. Find the height of the cone.
questions.exp: Using the curved surface area formula, the slant height is calculated as 130 cm. Applying the Pythagoras theorem gives the height of the cone as 120 cm.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: Two pipes A and B can fill a tank of 3700 litres in 9 hours and 6 hours respectively. If opened together, how long will they take to fill a tank of 6400 litres?
questions.exp: The combined filling rate is obtained by adding the individual rates of both pipes. Dividing the required capacity by this combined rate gives the total time as 1152/185 hours.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: The difference between compound interest and simple interest on ₹47,100 at 9% per annum for 2 years is:
questions.exp: For two years, the difference between compound interest and simple interest is calculated using the standard formula, which gives the result as ₹381.51.

questions.subject: General Awareness
questions.q: Who among the following was NOT part of the Santhal Rebellion?
questions.exp: Kanho, Bhairav and Chand were leaders of the Santhal Rebellion of 1855, whereas the Tana Bhagats were associated with a later tribal movement and not with the Santhal uprising.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: The arithmetic mean of 25 real numbers is 110. If 10 numbers are increased by 12.5 each, another 10 numbers are increased by 15 each and the remaining 5 numbers are unchanged, find the new arithmetic mean.
questions.exp: The total increase in all values is 275. Dividing this increase by 25 gives an increase of 11 in the mean. Adding this to the original mean gives the new arithmetic mean as 121.

questions.subject: General Science
questions.q: In which order did Mendeleev arrange the elements in his periodic table?
questions.exp: Mendeleev arranged the elements in his periodic table in the increasing order of their atomic masses.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: Rajesh has 156 litres of Oil A and 256 litres of Oil B. He fills a number of identical containers with the two types of oil in such a way that each container has only one type of oil and all containers are completely filled. What is the maximum volume of each container?
questions.exp: The maximum volume of each container is obtained by finding the highest common factor of 156 and 256, which is 4 litres.

questions.subject: General Awareness
questions.q: Which of the following farming practices is mostly practised in Northeast India and causes soil erosion?
questions.exp: Shifting agriculture involves cutting and burning vegetation, which leaves the soil exposed and leads to heavy soil erosion, especially in Northeast India.

questions.subject: Current Affairs
questions.q: What is the percentage change in allocation for the Smart Cities Mission from the Revised Estimates of 2023-24 to the Budget Estimates of 2024-25?
questions.exp: The allocation for the Smart Cities Mission was reduced by approximately 70 percent in the Budget Estimates of 2024-25 compared to the previous year.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q:
Read the statements and conclusions carefully and decide which conclusion logically follows.
Statements: All cars are buses. All buses are trucks. Some buses are ships.
Conclusions: (I) Some ships are cars. (II) All trucks are cars.
questions.exp: Although cars are included in buses and buses are included in trucks, the given statements do not guarantee that ships are cars or that all trucks are cars, so neither conclusion follows.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: Sunil starts from Point A and drives 11 km towards the south, then turns left and drives 3 km, turns left and drives 4 km, turns left and drives 12 km, and finally turns right and drives 7 km to reach Point P. How far and in which direction should he drive to reach Point A again?
questions.exp: After completing all movements, Sunil is positioned 9 km to the west of the starting point, so he must drive 9 km towards the east to return to Point A.

questions.subject: General Awareness
questions.q: The popular folk dance of Bihar which depicts the love and quarrel of a married couple is called:
questions.exp: Jat-Jatin is a traditional folk dance of Bihar that portrays the emotions, love, and quarrels of a married couple.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: What should come in place of the question mark in the series VCJ RYF NUB JQX ?
questions.exp: Each letter in the series moves backward by four positions in the English alphabet, resulting in the next term as FMT.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: Each of C, D, E, F, S, T and U has an exam on a different day from Monday to Sunday. Based on the given conditions, who has the exam on Friday?
questions.exp: By arranging all persons according to the given conditions, it is found that S is scheduled to have the exam on Friday.

questions.subject: General Science
questions.q: In holozoic nutrition, what is the first essential step?
questions.exp: In holozoic nutrition, the first step is ingestion, which involves taking food into the body.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: Simplify: $194 + [6 \times (1 - 6 + 5)] \div 12$
questions.exp: First simplify the bracket $(1 - 6 + 5) = 0$, then $6 \times 0 = 0$ and $0 \div 12 = 0$, so the final value is $194 + 0 = 194$.

questions.subject: Computer
questions.q: What is the primary function of an operating system in a laptop?
o: To manage hardware and software resources
questions.exp: An operating system controls and manages the hardware and software resources of a computer and provides a platform for running application programs.

questions.subject: Current Affairs
questions.q: Who took part in the 69th Session of the United Nations Commission on the Status of Women (UNCSW), held at the UN Headquarters in New York?
questions.exp: Annapurna Devi, the Union Minister for Women and Child Development, participated in the 69th session of the United Nations Commission on the Status of Women.

questions.subject: General Awareness
questions.q: What is the major constraint in dry land farming?
questions.exp: Dry land farming is practiced in regions with very low rainfall, therefore insufficient availability of water is the major constraint.

questions.subject: Current Affairs
questions.q: In April 2025, Chief Justice Sanjiv Khanna named ________ as his successor, who will be the ________ upon appointment.
o: Justice B R Gavai; 53rd Chief Justice of India
Justice B R Gavai; 52nd Chief Justice of India
Justice Hima Kohli; 53rd Chief Justice of India
Justice Surya Kant; 51st Chief Justice of India
questions.exp: Chief Justice Sanjiv Khanna named Justice B R Gavai as his successor, who will become the 52nd Chief Justice of India after appointment.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: In a certain code language, A + B mea A is the mother of B, A - B mea A is the brother of B, A x B mea A is the wife of B and A ÷ B mea A is the father of B. How is M related to Q if $M + N - O ÷ P \times Q$?
questions.exp: From the expression, $P \times Q$ shows P is the wife of Q, $O ÷ P$ shows O is the father of P, and $M + N$ shows M is the mother of O, therefore M is the mother of Q’s wife’s father.

questions.subject: General Awareness
questions.q: Saura painting, a tribal art form, is traditionally practiced by communities in which Indian state?
questions.exp: Saura painting is a traditional tribal art form practiced by the Saura community of Odisha.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: In a certain code language, ‘pizza base queen’ is coded as ‘du su qw’ and ‘pig queen wave’ is coded as ‘ic fv su’. How is ‘queen’ coded?
questions.exp: The word ‘queen’ appears in both codes and the common code corresponding to it is ‘su’.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: The curved surface area of a right circular cone is $5400\pi \text{ cm}^2$ and the diameter of its base is $144 \text{ cm}$. Find the height of the cone.
questions.exp: Using $\pi r l = 5400\pi$ gives $l = 75$, and applying $h = \sqrt{l^2 - r^2}$ with $r = 72$ gives $h = \sqrt{75^2 - 72^2} = 21$.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q:
If the mode of the following data is 140, then what is the value of x?
![](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/Ashwin-Temp/exam-master-assets/images/reasoning/tablesssss.webp)
questions.exp: Since the mode lies at the boundary value 140, the frequencies of the two adjacent classes must be equal, therefore x=33.

questions.subject: Computer
questions.q: What is the main purpose of cache memory in a computer?
o: To store frequently accessed data for quick retrieval
questions.exp: Cache memory stores frequently used data and instructions so that the CPU can access them faster than accessing them from the main memory.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: Kamlesh buys some sarees and suits for ₹10000. The cost of each saree is ₹1500 and the cost of each suit is ₹1000. The total number of sarees and suits is 8. Find the number of suits and sarees.
questions.exp: Let the number of sarees be $x$ and suits be $y$, then $x+y=8$ and $1500x+1000y=10000$, solving these equations gives $x=4$ and $y=4$.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: What is the ratio of the angles subtended by a chord at the centre of a circle to the angle subtended at any point on the circumference of the circle?
questions.exp: The angle subtended by a chord at the centre of a circle is always twice the angle subtended by it at any point on the circumference.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: Find the value of $m$ which satisfies $(\frac{29}{4})^{3}\times(\frac{4}{29})^{2}\times(\frac{29}{4})^{11}=(\frac{4}{29})^{9m+7}$.
questions.exp: Converting all terms to the base $(\frac{29}{4})$ and equating powers gives $12=-(9m+7)$, which on solving gives $m=-\frac{19}{9}$.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: If '+' mea '-', '-' mea '×', '×' mea '+', and '÷' mea '+', then what will be the value of 502 ÷ 78 + 2 - 258 × 2?
questions.exp: Replacing the operators as per the given conditions and then solving the equation step by step gives the final value as 322.

questions.subject: Current Affairs
questions.q: In April 2025, India and China initiated discussions to resume direct passenger flights that had been suspended since which year?
questions.exp: Direct passenger flights between India and China were suspended in the year 2020.

questions.subject: Computer
questions.q: Which of the following best describes the role of an operating system kernel?
o: Acting as an interface between applications and hardware
questions.exp: The kernel is the core part of an operating system that directly communicates with the hardware and manages system resources.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: This question is based on the five three-digit numbers 956, 521, 251, 156 and 335. What will be the result if the second digit of the highest number is added to the first digit of the lowest number?
questions.exp: The highest number is 956 whose second digit is 5 and the lowest number is 156 whose first digit is 1, so the result is $5+1=6$.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: This question is based on the words DIE, CUP, BOX and ASK. After applying the given vowel and consonant changes, in how many resulting letter clusters will no vowel appear?
questions.exp: After applying the given rules, only CJF and BRJ contain no vowels, so the total number is two.

questions.subject: General Awareness
questions.q: Which author wrote the novel 'Held', shortlisted for the Booker Prize 2024?
questions.exp: The novel 'Held', which was shortlisted for the Booker Prize 2024, was written by Anne Michaels.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: What is the discriminant of the equation $x^{2}-2x+13=0?$ Also, determine how many real solutions this equation has.
questions.exp: Discriminant is calculated using $D=b^{2}-4ac$. Here $a=1$, $b=-2$, $c=13$. Substituting values gives $D=(-2)^{2}-4(1)(13)=4-52=-48$. Since the discriminant is negative, the equation has no real roots.

questions.subject: General Awareness
questions.q: What role did the Indian People's Theatre Association (IPTA) play during the British rule?
questions.exp: IPTA used theatre, music, and performances as tools to oppose British rule and highlight social and political issues among the masses.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: A group of people consists of men, women and children. Among them, 20% are men, 50% are women and the rest are children, and their average weights are 45 kg, 60 kg and 20 kg respectively. The average weight of the group is:
questions.exp: Assume total people as 100. Men are 20, women are 50 and children are 30. Total weight is $(20 \times 45)+(50 \times 60)+(30 \times 20)=900+3000+600=4500$. Average weight is $4500/100=45$ kg.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: When $x$ is added to each of 26, 40, 22 and 34, the numbers so obtained are in proportion. If $4x:y::y:(7x-6)$ and $y>0$, find the value of $y$.
questions.exp: From proportionality, $\frac{26+x}{40+x}=\frac{22+x}{34+x}$. Solving gives $(26+x)(34+x)=(40+x)(22+x)$ which simplifies to $x=2$. Substituting in $4x:y::y:(7x-6)$ gives $8:y::y:8$, so $y^{2}=64$ and $y=8$.

questions.subject: General Science
questions.q: What is the primary purpose of the vertical planetary mixer developed by ISRO in Feb 2025?
o: To enhance the efficiency and safety of solid rocket motor manufacturing
To develop new materials for spacecraft
questions.exp: The mixer is used to uniformly mix solid propellant ingredients, which improves safety and efficiency during solid rocket motor manufacturing.

questions.subject: Current Affairs
questions.q: Where was the 13th Governing Council Meeting of the Bay of Bengal Inter-Governmental Organization (BOBP-IGO) held?
questions.exp: The official meeting venue for the 13th Governing Council session was Male in the Maldives.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: Which option follows the same pattern as 3-5-10-12?
questions.exp: In the given sequence, $3+2=5$, $5\times2=10$, and $10+2=12$. The pattern is $+2,\times2,+2$. Option 2 follows the same operations: $18+2=20$, $20\times2=40$, $40+2=42$.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: The angle of elevation of the top of a tower from a point on the ground is $30^\circ$ and the point is 48 m away. Find the height of the tower.
questions.exp: Using $\tan30^\circ=\frac{h}{48}$ and $\tan30^\circ=\frac{1}{\sqrt3}$, we get $h=\frac{48}{\sqrt3}=\frac{48\sqrt3}{3}=16\sqrt3$ m.

questions.subject: General Awareness
questions.q: Which schedule allows the creation of village councils or courts for tribal cases?
questions.exp: The Sixth Schedule provides constitutional provisions for autonomous councils and courts in tribal areas.

questions.subject: Computer
questions.q: What is the function of Alt + F2 in the Linux GNOME desktop environment?
questions.exp: Pressing Alt + F2 opens the Run Command dialog box, allowing users to execute commands directly.

questions.subject: General Awareness
questions.q: Which of the following rivers is NOT a tributary of the Ganga but flows directly into the Bay of Bengal?
questions.exp: Gomti, Ghaghara and Kosi join the Ganga river system, whereas the Mahanadi flows independently and drains directly into the Bay of Bengal.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: What should come in place of the question mark (?) in the given series? 802 800 796 790 782 ?
questions.exp: The differences between consecutive terms are −2, −4, −6 and −8, so the next difference is −10, and $782 - 10 = 772$.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: Based on the English alphabetical order, three of the following four letter-clusters are alike in a certain way and thus form a group. Which letter-cluster DOES NOT belong to that group?
questions.exp: In KGE, SOM and WSQ, the alphabetical gaps follow the pattern −4 and −2, whereas DAX has gaps of −3 and −3, so it does not follow the same rule.

questions.subject: Current Affairs
questions.q: As of February 2025, how many youth were trained in vocational skills under the Nehru Yuva Kendra Sangathan initiatives?
questions.exp: The officially reported number of youths trained under NYKS vocational skill initiatives up to February 2025 is 28,275.

questions.subject: General Awareness
questions.q: Which ruler regained his lost kingdom by 1555 after defeating Sher Shah Suri's successors?
questions.exp: Humayun defeated the successors of Sher Shah Suri in 1555 and reoccupied the Mughal throne, ending the Second Afghan Empire.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: Each of T, U, V, W, X, Y and Z has an exam on a different day from Monday to Sunday. Who has the exam on Thursday?
questions.exp: X is fixed on Wednesday, and T must be on Sunday due to the three-person gap. The consecutive placement of V, Z and Y fits only from Thursday onward, placing V on Thursday.

questions.subject: Current Affairs
questions.q: What was the theme of ICA Global Cooperative Conference in November 2024?
questions.exp: The official theme announced for the ICA Global Cooperative Conference held in November 2024 was “Cooperatives Build Prosperity for All”.

questions.subject: General Awareness
questions.q: After the 97th Constitutional Amendment, for how long can an inconsistent state co-operative law remain in force?
questions.exp: The amendment allows any inconsistent state law to continue only for one year from the commencement of the Act unless amended earlier.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: AB is parallel to CD. Find the measure of $\angle EGF$.
questions.exp: Since AB ∥ CD, the angle corresponding to $\angle PEB$ at point F is $56^\circ$. Subtracting $\angle GFE = 47^\circ$ gives $\angle GEF = 92^\circ$. In $\triangle GEF$, the sum of angles is $180^\circ$, so $\angle EGF = 180^\circ - (92^\circ + 47^\circ) = 41^\circ$.

questions.subject: General Awareness
questions.q: What percentage of seats are reserved for women under the 106th Constitutional Amendment Act?
questions.exp: The amendment mandates one-third reservation, which corresponds to 33% of seats in legislatures.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: A vendor sold 5 chocolates for ₹1, thereby gaining 40%. How many chocolates did he buy for ₹1?
questions.exp: Selling price of 5 chocolates is ₹1. Gain is 40%, so cost price of 5 chocolates is $1 \div 1.4 = \frac{5}{7}$. Cost price of 1 chocolate is $\frac{5}{7} \div 5 = \frac{1}{7}$. Hence, for ₹1 he bought 7 chocolates.

questions.subject: Geography
questions.q: Which of the following is a major river of the Indus basin system?
questions.exp: Ravi is one of the five major tributaries of the Indus river system, whereas Yamuna, Godavari and Kaveri belong to different river basins.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: What should come in place of the question mark (?) in the given series based on the English alphabetical order? FCA GDB HEC IFD ?
questions.exp: In each term, every letter moves forward by one position in the alphabet. F, G, H, I become J; C, D, E, F become G; A, B, C, D become E. Hence, the next term is JGE.

questions.subject: Current Affairs
questions.q: How much percentage of rural families rely on agriculture, livestock and Non-Timber Forest Products (NTFP) for their livelihoods?
questions.exp: As per the reported data, 90 percent of rural families depend on agriculture, livestock and non-timber forest products for their livelihood.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: A, B, C, D, G, H and I are sitting around a circular table facing the centre. Who sits third to the left of G?
questions.exp: Fix A at a reference point. Place H such that two people sit between A and H on A’s right. Place B such that three people sit between A and B. Place D such that two people sit between H and D. Place C immediately to the left of I. Completing the circular arrangement using all conditions shows that I is seated third to the left of G.

questions.subject: History
questions.q: Which ruler, upon his death in 1530, left behind a newly established empire across northern India?
questions.exp: Babur founded the Mughal Empire and at the time of his death in 1530, his empire extended across northern India from the Indus to Bihar and up to Gwalior.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q: Each of P, Q, R, S, T, U and V has an exam on a different day. How many people have the exam before V?
questions.exp: Fix P on Thursday. S must be after P. V must be after S and before Q. U must be after R and before T. Arranging all persons according to these conditions gives the order R, U, T, P, S, V, Q. Hence, five people have exams before V.

questions.subject: History
questions.q: Which of the following acts authorised the Governor General to override his council?
questions.exp: The Charter Act of 1793 extended the power of overriding the council to all future Governor Generals in matters affecting the British Empire.

questions.subject: Reasoning
questions.q:
In this question, a group of number/symbol is coded using letter codes as per the codes
given below and the conditions which follow.
The correct combination of codes (following only the condition/s that apply) is your
awer
![](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/Ashwin-Temp/exam-master-assets/images/reasoning/tabuallla.png)
Conditions:
(i) If the first element is a symbol and the last a number, the codes for these two (the
first and the last elements) are to be interchanged.
(ii) If the first element is an even number and the last an odd number, the first and last
elements are to be coded as ©
(iii) If both the second and third elements are perfect squares, the third element is to be
coded as the code for the second element.
questions.exp: The first number is even and the last number is odd, so both are coded as O. The remaining symbols and number are coded according to the given codes, resulting in OPZLO.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.q: At what rate of interest will a sum double itself in 12 years at simple interest?
questions.exp: For the sum to double, simple interest must equal the principal. Using $P = \frac{P \times R \times 12}{100}$ gives $R = \frac{100}{12} = 8.33\%$.
